entry.title: Split FormEventLoggerBase::RecordFunnelMetrics().
entry.content:
Key and funnel metrics for addresses and credit cards are emitted from

the FormEventLoggerBase.

Currently, all funnel metrics are emitted inside RecordFunnelMetrics().



For manual fallbacks, a specialized manual fallback FillAfterSuggestion

funnel metric should be implemented [1]. To do that, the same approach

that was used to implement AutofillProfile::Source-specific key-metrics

will be used:

- Emit each funnel metric from a separate function that's called from

RecordFunnelMetrics().

- In the AddressFormEventLogger (the one that emits address-specific

metrics), override RecordFillAfterSuggestion() and emit the manual

fallback specific metric.

Note that manual fallbacks are only relevant for address fields, since

credit card fields already ignore autocomplete=unrecognized.



This CL implements steps 1, by extracting the code for each funnel

metric into a separate function. This is purely mechanical.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.mowtw87e7p2c



Bug: 1007974

entry.title: [PGO] Add capability to fetch Android PGO profiles.
entry.content:
PGO profiles for Android (ARM and ARM64) builds were taken from mac-arm

builds since Android PGO bots previously failure and / or create empty

.profraw files.



These problems have been resolved, and we'd like to have Android PGO use

profiles created by Android PGO bots. The steps to do so are:

1a. Add /chrome/build/android*.pgo.txt files, which contain names of

gs://chromium-optimization-profiles/pgo_profiles/ .profdata files to

fetch.

1b. Update build scripts to fetch Android .profdata files on

"gclient runhooks", without using them (so still use mac-arm).

2. Add autorollers that will /chrome/build/android*.pgo.txt. This

entails adding .cfg files in the skia-autoroll-internal-config repro.

3. Change Android builds to use Android profiles instead of mac-arm.



This CL performs 1a) and 1b).



Bug: 1308749, 1464107

Change-Id: Ib10b15ccbcd69104e9fe70f59142eb5d6a4f370e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4722865

entry.title: Removes test
entry.content:
This test is doing the following:

1. Adds a BrowserListObserver.

2. Triggers startup browser creation

3. When Browser is created, observer added in 1 closes Browser

before startup completion is done. This schedules a task that

will delete the browser (by Views).

4. The observer added in 1 also schedules a task to end the

RunLoop in the test.

5. Startup browser creation continues, adding tabs to

a browser that is scheduled for deletion.

6. Task scheduled by 3 completes, deleting browser and calling

to observer added in 1 so that browser is marked as null.

7. Task scheduled in 4 completes, ending test.



Adding a WebContents to a Browser that is closed is problematic,

because it'll be deleted without doing any processing (such as

checking for unload handlers). I'm in the process of disallowing

it (adding CHECK)



This test is triggering the path I'm trying to disallow.



This test is exercising a very unusual path (closing a browser

during startup before it's actually shown), and as such is not

valid. I would like to remove it. As we're close to a branch

point I would like to remove it now and am happy to follow

up with a test if you outline the exact scenario you would like

to test.



Bug: 1434387



Change-Id: I62b90c7a28b51e3954f46c556822c632d02c1269

entry.title: Add tests for connection migration failure race.
entry.content:
* `closeSessionOnErrorLater` introduces a race where another thread can post a task to the networking thread while a session is being destroyed. This was avoided in the past by not deleting the sockets until the session destructor is called. However, https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4570128 destroyed the sockets during `onConnectionClosed()` which has led to crashes happening due the race condition surfacing. This CL only adds tests to make sure the crash does not resurface in the future. A proper fix would be deleting all usages of `closeSessionOnErrorLater` and replacing it with `closeSessionOnError` so we can avoid the race completely.

* Added 5 different unit-tests all using the same scenario where another thread posts a network change task immediately on the networking thread but each unit-test go through different codepaths.

* Added a test for failing connection migration due to lack of spare CID.

* Added a test for failing connection migration due to UDP socket connect error.

* Added a test for failing connection migration due to no active streams.

* Added a test for failing connection migration due to handshake not confirmed.

* Added a test for two sessions failing connection migration due to handshake not confirmed. This is to ensure that removing sessions while iterating does not cause crashes.



Bug: 1465889

Change-Id: Id44c3e5f506c9f3ada43ad993ed90748f5a7b95c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705611

entry.title: Robolectric: Restrict to single shard when --wait-for-java-debugger
entry.content:
It doesn't make sense to spin up multiple shards when they are going to

wait for a debugger to attach (and makes it hard to know which one to

attach to).



Also reduces the number of workers when --shard-filter is passed

to match the number of active shards.

entry.title: 🧪 Make WaitForPickerLoadStop not depend on NotificationService
entry.content:
NotificationService and NOTIFICATION_LOAD_STOP are being removed, but we

were using it to wait for page loads to complete on a currently

inaccessible (or not yet created) WebContents instance.



This CL uses the mechanism recently added to support such waits for

Kombucha (see crrev.com/c/4491226) to let WaitForPickerLoadStop keep

supporting this usecase.



As part of the changes, WaitForPickerLoadStop is being split into

new functions that clarify whether we are waiting for a specific URL

or just for the next navigation





Bug: 170921

entry.title: Fix BrowsingDataModelTest with CompressionDictionaryTransportBackend
entry.content:
Currently BrowsingDataModelTest.ConcurrentDeletions and

BrowsingDataModelTest.DelegateDataDeleted fails when

CompressionDictionaryTransportBackend feature is enabled. This is

because NetworkContext::GetSharedDictionaryUsageInfo() IPC is called

if the feature is enabled.



To fix this failure, this CL adds EXPECT_CALL() of

GetSharedDictionaryUsageInfo() method.



The behavior of the feature itself is tested by

BrowsingDataModelSharedDictionaryTest in the test file below.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: [iOS] Remove the DWC in deallocs
entry.content:
All of those DWC should eventually holds.

However, most of them were introduced before 116 branched, and can not safely be corrected in 116.

I thus want to remove them until:

* crbug.com/1464966 is fixed (as it wos the expected cause of many of those crashes)

* all crashes that has been found by those DWC with beta testers are solved.



Once we fill safe those DWC won’t trigger, or at least will very

rarely trigger and be safe for the crash reporting system, those DWC

should be put back.

entry.title: Populate chrome://files-internals/debug.json asynchronously
entry.content:
This commit essentially changes "GetDebugJSON returns a base::Value" to

"GetDebugJSONForKey runs a base::OnceCallback".

Callees can therefore populate their base::Value asynchronously.



Currently, all callees (there's only one so far, in fusebox_server.cc)

remain synchronous, but future commits might add async callees.

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Fix crash caused by invalid state transition
entry.content:
Fix the crash reported in https://crash.corp.google.com/907fd96a127686cf



The crash is caused by the invalid state transition of |state_| from

State::kCompleted to State::kDataTransferFinished, according to the

dump.



If there is a network error, this class transitions |state_| to

kCompleted. At that timing data pipe producer handles are canceled.

However, simple watchers still watch data pipe changes, that means they

may call additional callbacks, which are ReadAndWrite() and proceed to

invalid states, specifically

TransitionState(State::kDataTransferFinished) called by

OnDataTransferComplete().



This CL proactively cancels those watchers in CompleteResponse() not to

call another ReadAndWrite().



Bug: 1468719

Change-Id: Ie01ebc2e911a20a1bb51743f1be5505545f529b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4731122

entry.title: [iOS] Bottom sheet should wait for cookies only triggered from the web
entry.content:
This patch update the bottom sheet (ConsistencyPromoSigninMediator)

to not wait for the identities cookies to be updated in the WKWebView

when the sign-in dialog is triggered from any other access point than

web sign-in.

This is relevant to have the same behaviour with or without

`kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos` flag.



Also this patch changes when the cookie timeout is started.

It was not relevant to start the timeout when the authentication flow

was started. To be consistant with all other sign-in dialog, the

cookie timeout timer is now started once the sign-in flow is finished

and want to wait to for the cookies to updated.



Bug: 1468408

entry.title: Exclude fieldDecls inside Macros
entry.content:
Exclude fieldDecls in macro code. It is important to note that

`isInMacroLocation()` is also true for fields annotated with

RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION. These fields are not added to `field_exclusions` as

they are handled differently by the `excluded_field_decl` matcher.



Before this fix, vectors in mocked method signatures, for example:

`MOCK_CONST_METHOD1(Get, void(std::vector*));`

or

`MOCK_CONST_METHOD1(Get, void(std::vector&));`

or any other variation, were always rewritten due to the signature being

stored as a field in the macro code. This change fixes this issue and

removes the unnecessary rewrite while also keeping the intended

behaviour for RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION annotated fields.



Change-Id: I1fe45de9862db07d03f0959296d3e5bef1a3898e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720966

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Ali Hijazi

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177144}

entry.title: Flags UI: Simplify scrolling container and header placement.
entry.content:
- Stop using a sticky header.

- Change the scrolling container from body to #body-container



The above simplifies the CSS code (less calculations), makes it easier

to scroll flag entries to the top of the viewport, and also results in a

more intuitive UI where only the part that holds the flags entries is

scrollable, such that the scrollbar does not extend into the header

area.

entry.title: Remove unnecessary IsSyncFeatureEnabled/Active checks in iOS history
entry.content:
There was one call site each of IsSyncFeatureEnabled() and

IsSyncFeatureActive(), both of which also checked GetActiveDataTypes(),

meaning the Sync-feature check was unnecessary.



Without kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos, there's no behavior

difference.

With kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos, this CL makes things work

based on history opt-in (rather than sync-the-feature).



Bug: 1462286

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /skia
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Make Ash source of truth for PdfOcrAlwaysActive pref.
entry.content:
PdfOcrAlwaysActive preference is kept both in LaCrOS and Ash, and kept

in sync for all active profiles. But if user changes the pref when a

profile is not active, the pref will not be updated in that profile.



To fix the issue, the pref value is feteched from Ash when

PdfOcrController is constructed for each LaCrOS profile.



AX-Relnotes: n/a

entry.title: Make history traversal helpers works for restarted BFCache navigation
entry.content:
Previously we used `HistoryGoBackAndWaitForNavigationFinished` for

history navigation that may be restarted due to BFCache eviction.

This CL merge the logic into `HistoryGoBack` and only use this set

of helper functions to avoid breaking the convention of writing

browser tests.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Only set HEVC .num_delta_pocs_of_ref_rps_idx on ChromeOS
entry.content:
The HEVC decode parameter .num_delta_pocs_of_ref_rps_idx field was

very recently added to support MediaTek's stateless HEVC decoder. It

was accepted upstream, but hasn't been part of a release yet, and so

hasn't trickled down into a distro package that can be included in the

sysroots.



Guard the field assignment for now so that the Linux builds can proceed.



Bug: b:258331312, b:291169645

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Notify NonClientFrameView to update rounded corners
entry.content:
This CL notifies NonClientFrameView to update the rounded corners in

ChromeOS for following situations:

* SidePanel opens or closes.

* Devtools opens or closes.

* Devtools docked position changes.



This is necessary as in chromeOS, for ash browser, we round its bottom

two corners by rounding the respective corners of visible client

contents i.e main web content, devtools web content and side panel.



Bug: 1415486, b:287060338

Change-Id: Idf09ee39b12c4a6e84c804364778db39eb8eda2b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727948

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Commit-Queue: Zoraiz Naeem

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177077}

entry.title: arc: Implement scale factor request
entry.content:
Partly analogous to Lacros change: crrev.com/c/4034899.



With this CL, ClientControlledShellSurface switches to

scale factor request model.



- This CL removes `scale_`, `pending_scale_`, GetScale(), and

CommitPendingScale() defined in ClientControlledShellSurface,

which contributes to reduce duplication of similar logic.



- As ARC R+ requests bounds in pixels, Exo converts them to DP, but

as the scale factor requested for these bounds-related requests

are effective in the next commit, ClientControlledShellSurface

needs access to the pending scale in ShellSurfaceHost to do the

proper conversion. (This assumes that ARC sends the next scale

factor before bounds requests.)



Bug: b/290565343

Bug: b/276985752

Test: Manually test multi-display with ARC P/R/T

Change-Id: If59c08ec635e0af96d8db9d2fc69bda03e6e6293

entry.title: cros_next: fixed shelf unittest failure
entry.content:
This cl fixed the failure of shelf manager unit test due to the

crash of the overview item shadow.



The crash is due to the small test window which is 1x370 which will

not appear in real case. The small size leads to a negative adjusted

shadow elevation and finally make the shadow layer smaller than its

nine patch layer's border.



The cl fixed the issue by setting a more meaningful size to test

window.



Test: ShelfLayoutManagerTest.VisibleInOverview

Bug: b:293400777

Change-Id: I479a562dfe71e241982b7dbf43b8c10ea8f5bd86

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727783

Reviewed-by: Toni Barzic

Commit-Queue: Xiaodan Zhu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177062}
